A non-peer reviewed periodical, usually published daily or weekly, consisting primarily of editorials and news items concerning current or recent events and matters of public interest.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: newspaper
newspaper article
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An article written by a journalist and published in a newspaper.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: concept
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
A SKOS concept can be viewed as an idea or notion; a unit of thought. However, what constitutes a unit of thought is subjective, and this definition is meant to be suggestive, rather than restrictive.
The notion of a SKOS concept is useful when describing the conceptual or intellectual structure of a knowledge organization system, and when referring to specific ideas or meanings established within a KOS.
Note that, because SKOS is designed to be a vehicle for representing semi-formal KOS, such as thesauri and classification schemes, a certain amount of flexibility has been built in to the formal definition of this class.
An internal identifier for journals available from the National Library of Medicine repository.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has National Library of Medicine journal identifier
laboratory notebook
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A notebook used by an individual research scientist as the primary record of his or her research activities. A researcher may use a laboratory notebook to document hypotheses, to describe experiments and to record data in various formats, to provide details of data analysis and interpretation, or to record the validation or invalidation of the original hypotheses. The laboratory notebook serves as an organizational tool and a memory aid. It may also have a role in recording and protecting any intellectual property created during the research, and may be used in evidence when establishing priority of discoveries, for example in patent applications. Electronic versions of laboratory notebooks are increasingly being employed by researchers, particularly in chemistry and the pharmaceutical industry.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: executive summary
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An executive summary is a brief report summarizing a longer formal report, designed to present the key points, conclusions and recommendations arising from the study being reported, for readers too busy to take the time to read the complete report.
A report of a meeting of some kind.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: meeting report

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An editorial published in an issue of a magazine.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: magazine editorial

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A written review and critical analysis of the purpose, features, performance and other qualities of a product.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: product review

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mapping of correspondences between two vocabularies. For controlled vocabularies, such mappings may be expressed using SKOS (http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vocabulary mapping
is part of
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Meaning = is part of. As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#partOf), a property indicating that one entity is a part of another entity.
As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#embodimentOf), a property representing an expression that is embodied by a manifestation.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is embodiment of

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The date on which something, for example a document, is corrected.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has correction date

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An unpublished paper, usually circulated privately among a small group of peers, to provide information or with a request for comments or editorial improvement.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: working paper

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A unique identifing number issued by a patent authority to identify a patent, displayed at the beginning of the patent document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has patent number

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A graphical means of presenting data in a grid of rows and columns, within which the cells usually contain alphanumeric text or numeric values. If included within a publication, a table typically appearing unaligned with the main body of text, with its own descriptive title.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: table

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A recorded sequence of connected steps, which may be automated, specifying a reliably repeatable sequence of operations to be undertaken when conducting a particular job, for example an in silico investigation that extracts and processes information from a number of bioinformatics databases.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: workflow
newspaper issue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A particular published issue of a newspaper, identified by date, and sometimes also by place or time (e.g. 'Late London Edition').

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: algorithm
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A precise sequential set of pre-defined logical rules or computational operations to be employed for solving a particular problem in a finite number of steps.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: trial report
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The report of a trial, for example an experimental trial or a legal trial.
A document containing a vocabulary
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: vocabulary document
cloud
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A distributed and commoditized Internet-based computing resource, whereby shared services, software programs, and information storage facilities are provided to computers and other devices on demand, at locations of which the user may be unaware, like the electricity grid.
A document containing the programme and collected conference papers, or their abstracts, presented at a conference, seminar, symposium or similar event.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: conference proceedings
artistic work
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It describes any work regarded as art in its widest sense, including works from literature and music, visual art, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: report document
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The realization of a report, usually in printed form.
An article that contains a review.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: review article

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property expresses the fact that a scheme contains a concept.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is scheme of
dataset
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of related facts, often expressed in numerical form and encoded in a defined structure.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: collected works
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of the literary or scholastic works of a single person.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has embargo period
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The time period for which an entity is embargoed. During this period, the entity should not be published or, in the case of a press release, should not be reported on. For open-access journal articles, the embargo duration specifies that period of time during which availability of the open-access version of the article is delayed by the publisher, following subscription-access availability of the published work. The end of the embargo period can be specified by fabio:hasEmbargoDate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: journal editorial
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An editorial published in an issue of a journal.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: data management policy document
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document embodying a policy that descibes and defines how data should be managed, preserved and shared.
A concept that identifies a field of knowledge or human activity defined in a controlled vocabulary, such as Computer Science, Biology, Economics, Cookery or Swimming.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: subject discipline
opinion
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An expression of a personal or professional opinion on an issue or topic.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: supplement
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A supplement to a publication such as a book, journal, magazine or newspaper, additional to the main publication. For example, a colour supplement to a sunday newspaper, or a special supplementary issue of a journal or a journal volume containing invited articles on a special topic, or abstracts or papers presented at a scientific conference.

A collaborative Web manifestation, usually maintained by a project team or group, providing easy-to-edit pages that can be used to accumulate related information for shared use by the group and/or publication.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: wiki
policy document
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document embodying a policy that descibes and defines how something should be done.
As defined by FRBR (http://www.ifla.org/VII/s13/frbr/frbr1.htm; http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#exemplar), a property representing an item that exemplifies a manifestation.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has exemplar
paperback
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A print object with a flexible cover, usually made of paper or paperboard.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: short story
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A work of fiction that is usually written in prose, often in narrative format. This format tends to be more focused and less elaborate than longer works of fiction such as novels.
A formal correction to an error introduced by the publisher into a previously published document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: erratum
proposition
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A proposal or proposition of a new conceptualization, hypothesis, idea, theory, activity or organisation.
